name: Moderator Sharon
comment info:
Welcome to Wednesday's moderation of “What’s Going On in This Graph?”  

Today’s graph shows the two parts of President Biden’s economic plan:  $2.3 trillion Infrastructure Plan and $1.8 trillion Families Plan.  The diagram shows the President’s allocation of the $4.1 trillion of new spending and tax cuts to 50 programs.   The infrastructure plan would involve 8 years of spending paid for with 15 years of higher corporate taxes.  The Families Plan would cover over 10 years of spending and taxes on the wealthiest Americans.   To add some  perspective on these very large numbers, the 2020 annual U.S. Gross Domestic Product, a measure of the size of the economy, was $21.4 trillion. The recently released 2020 U.S. Census found 331 million people. 

From 9 am – 2 pm E.T. today, share with us your responses online.

By Friday morning, we’ll reveal the article that included this graphic and much more.  We look forward to reading your discoveries.

Note that you can get a link to your response to share with your teacher and classmates by clicking the response box below your response “Email me when my comment is published.”  

This is the last “What’s Going On In This Graph?” release of the school year.  We will return in early September.  Subscribe to the free NYT Learning Network newsletter to be notified of the next school year’s first release. 

Keep noticing and wondering.
